title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CaroMont Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was organized and simple. Everyone was welcoming throughout the process and very helpful. It definitely helped ease the nerves especially with this being my first nursing job. I recommend
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond

title: Nutrition Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CaroMont Health
Interview Descriptions: Relatively easy, phone interview than in person interview which was depending on who is there you are interviewed. Could be one person or a group interview then after that then orientation. It all went by pretty quickly and easily.
Interview Questions: What is a situation you’ve overcome

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was good and outstanding interview with three different mangers of laboratory setting They ask different questions regarding to work in group or alone, also it was discuss how would you handle difficult situation in past and give example
Interview Questions: About going PRN because they explain there is no benefits and it’s three days a week

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CaroMont Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the hospital website. A recruiter called me to set up an on-site interview. On-site was with three different department managers. I got an offer within a week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Past experience.

title: Case Management Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CaroMont Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a panel interview. The first portion was with leadership, the second portion was with the team. I felt that the team portion did not know anything about me or the questions the they were supposed to ask
Interview Questions:
Tell about yourself. 
Tell about a difficult situation that you encountered and how did you handle it.

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CaroMont Health in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a recruiter phone interview. 30 minutes long. The recruiter was very nice and told me she would give my application to the hiring manager. Nothing else came of it.
Interview Questions: What do you like about the company? How much do you want your salary to be? Will you be taking any vacation off in the near future? Tell me about your experience? What would your employers describe about you?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was tense , but great they was all wonderful.  I was offered two positions that day of my interview.  I can't wait to start working with caromont hospital.
Interview Questions: How well do I work with my peers when team work is needed or ask for help.

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CaroMont Health
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to come to sit in one of their rooms and I was interviewed by a panel consisting of nurse managers for different units. They were very welcoming and professional.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Tell me about your work experience?
What is your goal within your nursing career?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was held virtually, very professional, and laid back. I wish I could have been out on the floor though so that I could see what it is like. Overall, good experience.
Interview Questions: Telling me about yourself? What is your healthcare experience?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was great they have a new program where it was a virtual interview but I was able to interview with different departments within an hour and a half. Management was great and for what I heard the company seem like a great company and they people I interview with have been there for years so that said a lot about the company
Interview Questions: Everything my past employment history, why the change and about myself and what I can offer

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CaroMont Health
Interview Descriptions: Nurse manager was extremely friendly. I didn't feel rushed and I felt likee she truly cared about my nursing journey and success. In total it lasted about 30 minutes. Great interview!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and how you came into nursing

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CaroMont Health
Interview Descriptions: They started by asking me basic interview questions and they then allowed me to explain why I chose nursing as a career. It was scheduled to last 30 mins but ended being around 15.
Interview Questions: What was your reason for choosing nursing as a career?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CaroMont Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy panel interview with the med/surg units. Very informative and polite. Since COVID is causing so much havoc in NC, they are only doing phone interviews for now. But they handled it perfectly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Sr. Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gaston, NC) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Process was rather quick and  the team whom I interviewed with were all very nice.  The interview was really focused around my financial modeling experience specific to healthcare and gauging my fit with the team.  It was a nice break from the usual behavioral interview drudgery most firms employ.

The offers were incredibly low per market, both lower than where a non-Sr FA role midpoint is.  Basically offered 61k/yr to start and then came back with 66k/yr, a relocation reimbursement of$2500 and two $2500 retention bonuses (paid at 90days & 2yrs).   Salary is way below market and less than what I was making in a non-senior role.
Interview Questions: Describe modeling experience with new procedures?  What sort of variables and drivers do you include in modeling?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: So far it's been an awesome experience. Several different departments have called already. I have had one panel interview with three floors. I have also gotten two more interviews for next week before I make my decision.
Interview Questions: What about CaroMont Health makes you want to be a part of this team?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with manager and assistant manager.  Was asked to interview with staff after that.  Asked about my previous experience, length of my career, why leaving my current job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experience.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a peer interview with 4 or 5 staff members. They were very professional and gave time for me to ask my own questions. I liked that the nurses and nurses aides participated in the process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a member of our team?

title: Floor Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The  initial interview was with the DON of the rehab building.  We discussed previous job history and an overview of the facility I was interviewing at.  The DON sent my information to HR dept. for a second interview.
Interview Questions: The usual questions:  Your strengths/weakness,  how you have dealt with a difficult patient/family situation, what do you like the least and best about your profession

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Shelby, NC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the ADON first.  Also had a 3 panel interview.  Wasn't too bad. I was asked critical thinking questions, priority questions, dealing with grievances', upset residents, upset families.
Interview Questions: Why are you a nurse?

title: FNP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: very easy, felt very comfortable and informed throughout the entire process. Management was very helpful at the time. I very much felt wanted and that nobody was being untruthful or hiding things. it seemed we all just wanted to find the proper fit.
Interview Questions: what will you contribute to the workplace

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: great process, interview  was relaxed, I actually transferred into the position from nursing. It was a smooth transition.  The only drawback was all the former co-worker  not be able to make the transition.
Interview Questions: group panel

title: Patient Financial Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Nice relaxed interview. Tough questions were asked in a non threatening way. I feel like they got to know me on a personal and professional level. Which I feel is important.
Interview Questions: Don't remember, went over job specifics and duties and I felt comfortable asking questions as well

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CaroMont Health in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview standard questions, basic background information obtained.  Phone interview went through job responsibilities and was offered the job later that afternoon.  I do not know what else to say since glassdoor will not allow me to move forward
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PACU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Limited time, interviewer kept leaving room. Nurse recruiter had me interviewing for different job than I had applied for. Three team interviewing me but they were not attentive to me. They were cutting up and laughing with each other about their own personal life issues.
Interview Questions: Why do  you want to work here?

title: Cafeteria Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: You are called in for an interview by HR. Then you are taken to the cafeteria for a tour and to meet the current manager and shift supervisor who will also ask you more questions about your past experience. I wrote a letter thanking them for their time after the interview and telling them why I was a good fit for their team which is what impressed them the most. I heard back with a job offer almost two months later.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses. Why Caromont Health.

title: Tray Service Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CaroMont Health (Gastonia, NC) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was simple and that should of be a tip for me.  They almost didn't even pay attention to what I had on my resume but instead just wanted me because I showed up.
Interview Questions: N/A
